intro: Hieracium longisquamum, commonly known as the long-scale hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring temperate climates. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine, bristly hairs, while its flowers are yellow with ray florets. Hieracium longisquamum is often found in open habitats and can sometimes form dense colonies.
